common_issues.title: Pieces connectivity and login issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting Pieces extensions and plugins (VS Code, Chrome, Edge) to the Pieces OS.  Issues include continuous installation requests for the VS Code extension, inability to log in, and failure to connect even with VPN configurations.  Additionally, some users report Pro features not activating despite upgrading and logging in.  Troubleshooting steps include reinstalling dependencies, checking VPN settings, and verifying login status.

related_issues.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop app, including large markdown blocks in Copilot responses making scrolling difficult, inability to collapse code blocks, and problems with the Pieces sidebar.  Additionally, some users are experiencing issues with Pro settings not applying despite being logged in. Troubleshooting steps may include checking for updates, reinstalling the app, and ensuring account synchronization.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop Application Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with backup restoration, dependency installation, and sidebar functionality in the Pieces OS desktop and web applications. Backup restoration fails midway, dependency installation gets stuck on "Retry Step", and the sidebar has display issues.  Additionally, some Pro users are unable to access their upgraded features despite being logged in.  Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root causes and provide solutions.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs and UI Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop application, including unintended selection behavior (potentially related to shift/mouse click lock), inability to collapse code blocks, and sidebar display problems.  Additionally, some users experience issues with Pro settings not applying despite being logged in. Troubleshooting steps may include checking for software updates, verifying login status, and reviewing error logs.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues across multiple platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting Pieces extensions and plugins (Obsidian, Chrome, Edge) to Pieces OS.  Problems include undetected ports, failed logins, and pro features not activating. This affects Windows users, some using VPNs.  Check Pieces OS version, port settings (default changed to 39300), and ensure the Pieces desktop app is running.

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
related_issues.text:
Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS Version: 12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed Obsidian and added the Pieces extension. The chat works ok, but within Obsidian when I highlight text and right click to send to Pieces it fails. Checking inside Obsidian the Pieces setup it says Pieces port not detected, and does not allow me to set port for Pieces OS within Obsidian.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces extensions/plugins and Pieces OS across all platforms (Windows, macOS, Chrome, Edge, VS Code, Obsidian).  This includes addressing login failures, port detection problems, and Pro feature activation.

Investigate and fix issues with the Pieces desktop application, including the oversized markdown blocks in Copilot responses, code block collapsing, sidebar display problems, and unintended selection behavior.
Address problems with Pieces OS and desktop application core functionalities, such as backup restoration failures, dependency installation issues ("Retry Step"), and Pro settings not applying.
Improve communication with users regarding the change in default port to 39300 and provide clear troubleshooting steps for connection problems.
Investigate and resolve the high RAM/CPU usage issue reported in ticket #150.
